items.title: Marginal as Mixture Average
items.content:
188: :label: prop-marginal-mixture
189: 
190: From the finite de Finetti representation ({prf:ref}`thm-hewitt-savage-representation`) with $k=1$:
191: 
192: $$
193: \mu_N = \int_{\mathcal{P}(\Omega)} \mu \, d\mathcal{Q}_N(\mu)
194: $$
195: 
196: where $\mu_N$ is the single-particle marginal of $\pi_N$. This is an **exact** representation (the bound $k(k-1)/(2N) = 0$ for $k=1$).
